data.title: Invalid ConditionExpression/VariableExpression parsing of -
data.body:
A condition like `1+1` or any other binary expression except `-` will be happily parsed without whitespace.

`1-1` fails [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Support/ConditionExpression.cs#L325) because `-` is `CharClass.Mixed` instead of `CharClass.Operator`.  This check should allow Mixed characters because they are neither part of a number nor a variable name.

After amending that check, however, the failure moves [here](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Game/Support/ConditionExpression.cs#L576), and it's not immediately clear to me how to fix this.

This inconsistentcy is blocking the replacement of `Evaluator` in the chrome parsing with `IntegerExpression`.

I have only debug.log, irc.log and perf.log.
debug.log is uploaded here : https://ufile.io/cc0711.
Replay is uploaded here : https://uploadfiles.io/625d6.

data.title: Server now sends his ipv4 and ipv6.
data.body:
An user might have one or two ip adresses: ipv4 and ipv6. Some of them (like me) are using Dual-Stick-Lite. Resulting in a shared ipv4, and dedicated ipv6. While unable to host games when missing ipv4 or having a shared ipv4 address, this PR allows you to actualy provide both.

The MasterServer now has to evaluate this and store both of them instead of only the default REMOTE_ADDR - which btw is always ipv4 currently due to missing ipv6 DNS entries. But even if these entries would exist, users like me will still connect using the shared ipv4 - resulting in never being able to host at all without this addition.

After this PR is accepted, i will make another PR for the master server to support these new parameters and handle ipv4 and ipv6.

Sidenote: Might be a good idea to detect whether the player can connect to ipv4 and ipv6 adressed and filtering them in the lobby (or marking them with "you are missing ipvx support")

data.title: Missing high resolution and source artwork for D2K mod logo
data.body:
We have two problems with the D2K logo:
* The sources for the current version were not added to the [artwork source repository](https://github.com/OpenRA/ArtSrc/tree/master/d2k).  The moons are noticeably different.
* The logo was created in 2D, and is too small to use for native system icons for the new mod launchers.  OSX requires sizes rendered up to 1024px for best results, and even windows wants at least a 256px version.  The largest version we have is ~110px.

The most efficient approach will be to recreate the logo in 3D so that we can render out the resolutions we need.

data.title: Fix keys scrolling stuck (+ some function double calls)
data.body:
After each pressed hotkey for saving viewport bookmark or jumping to bookmark/edge, it was executed twice.
I found it while looking at #13111 which is also solved by this PR. 
With pressed a control key (ctrl/shift/alt) + up/down/left/right, depending on order of up/down events of these keys, it can happen that despite releasing all keys, the viewport is still scrolling to one of edges and doesn't react anymore properly to scroll keys.

Fixes #13111.
Fixes #2075.
Fixes #10828

data.title: ProvidesRandomPrerequisite (i.e. YR Tech Secret Lab)
data.body:
Actually what was in my mind was a Random Condition Granter, rather than Prerequisite Provider, but it looks like `ProvidesPrerequisite:` is not conditional. Making `ProvidesPrerequisite:` conditional and adding a `GrantsRandomCondition:` might be a better approach.

What i need such trait for is in my D2K mod, i'm planning to give Ixian IX Lab ability to give one of other sides IX Lab tier unit randomly.

Here is a example .yaml code of how it may look like.

    ix_reseach_center:
      ProvidesRandomPrerequisite@Ixian:
        RandomiseForEach: false # if true, different ix_reseach_center: actors can provide different prerequisites, if false all provide same thing during the same game
        Factions: ixians # can also be set under each prerequisite
        ResetOnOwnerChange: false
        Prerequisite@1:
          Prerequisites: ix.sonic
          Chance: 8
        Prerequisite@2:
          Prerequisites: ix.deviator
          Chance: 10
        Prerequisite@3:
          Prerequisites: ix.devastator
          Chance: 7
    ...........................

Apart from my mod plan, we need that for RA2 mod as i said on Title anyway. Not sure if that would belong to commons or RA2 mod dll tho.

data.title: Allow experience to be supressed with garrisoned units.
data.body:
This is also aimed towards the RA pillboxes as a way to have them be a less of a threat and perhaps function more consistently. Personally I had no idea up until a few months ago that the garrisoned unit gained experience, quickly increasing the pillbox-efficiency when in action.

Quoting related comment by Frame Limiter:

```
Unfortunately I wasn't able to do it because the GainsExperience trait doesn't have Conditions that can enable or disable the trait. 

I think if GainsExperience had conditions you could simply do this:

^GainsExperience:
+GainsExperience:
++RequiresCondition: !Garrisoned

PBOX:
+Cargo:
++PassengerConditions:
+++e1: Garrisoned

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/GainsExperience.cs


AFAIK the only way it's possible right now is if you made the pillbox initial actor a technician and then removed GainsExperience from the technicians.

I also tried making the pillbox AttackTurreted instead of AttackGarrisoned but it doesn't work with "initial actors" so you need to exit and re-enter to get them to shoot. 
```

Perhaps there are uses beyond the pillbox but regardless it would allow for more options around RA balancing around its hottest topic.

data.title: Scroll-Lock while using viewport bookmaks
data.body:
Found this bug while reviewing #13096 .

If you simultaneousely scroll with keyboard input (i.e. "UP") and recall a viewport bookmark (i.e. "ALT+Q") the view wont stop scrolling up after releasing "UP", locking the view scrolling upwards. Edge scrolling or scrolling with mouse buttons held down while recalling a bookmark doesnt trigger this bug.
recreate:
1. bookmark a view ("ctrl"+"q")
2. press "UP" or "DOWN" or ...
3. also press "ALT+Q"
-> your viewport is now scroll-locked

I could not find an obvious reason in the code.
Should not be too dramatic of a bug because of rare occurrence, but I wanted to post it anyway.

data.title: AttackGarrisoned trait
data.body:
I'm having a problem with this trait, it seems to drop all attacks if it encounters a weapon that can't attack the target despite others being capable.

To reproduce this issue:
using the RA mod set the yaml PBOX cargo size & weight to 5.
set the initial unit from e1 to e3.
set the AttackGarrisoned, Armaments: to "primary,secondary".

now in game place a pill box and build a land unit and air unit, notice how you can force fire on the air unit and it works fine, but it will not attack the land unit at all. if you add other units inside they will also not attack unless they can hit the aircraft, also works in reverse with the rocket soldier going in last being unable to attack aircraft.

This issue stops garrisons from having more than a single weapon and having single unit cargo. I'm not sure if it was set up in RA to get around this bug, but I think it will be a good idea to fix for other mods.

having downloading the source and messing around with AttackGarrisoned.cs I noticed that commenting out line 159 and 160
158				var barrel = a.CheckFire(a.Actor, facing.Value, target);
159				//if (barrel == null)
160				//	return;
this makes it work as intended and without error so hopefully someone can work out why the return cancels the other armaments as I need this for a mod, thank you.
